page.title: 06WICHENFORD PARISH CHURCH
page.content: {St. Laurence's Church}Wichenford is one of four small village churches under the care of{Reverend Goddard. The building has stood since the {1400's}and contains tombs and effigies of the{Washbournes,}early parish squires, whose descendants now live in America, but still maintain and visit their ancestral church. There are{six Sunday services}a month; four Communions, one Mattins and a Family Service. The{old prayer book}is used for two of the Communions, and the{Alternate Service}book otherwise. All church festivals are celebrated, as is the{Parish Fete in June. A{leather bound bible}was presented by the Britten family in{1867.}100 years later two grandsons read the lessons, and that same bible used today . Patron,{St. Laurence,}was a{martyr burned in Rome for his Christianity.
